analyzed: milindapañha  anumāna pañha  nippa pañca vagga
translated: The Questions of King Milinda🔽The Chapter on Inference🔽The Unshakable
The Questions on the Training Precepts Without Exception

original: “Bhante nāgasena, ye te ahesuṁ tikicchakānaṁ pubbakā ācariyā seyyathidaṁ—
analyzed: bhante nāgasena ye te ahesum tikicchakānam pubbakāḥ ācariyā
translated: “Venerable Nāgasena, those who were the ancient teachers of physicians, namely

original: nārado dhammantarī aṅgiraso kapilo kaṇḍaraggi sāmo atulo pubbakaccāyano, sabbepete
analyzed: nāradaḥ dhammantarī aṅgirasaḥ kapilaḥ kaṇḍaraggi sāmaḥ atulaḥ pubbakaccāyanaḥ sabbepete
translated: Nārada, Dhammantari, Aṅgira, Kapila, Kaṇḍaraja, Sāma, Atula, Pubbakaccāyana, all these

original: ācariyā sakiṁyeva roguppattiñca nidānañca sabhāvañca samuṭṭhānañca tikicchañca kiriyañca
analyzed: ācariyā sa kiyā iva roga uppattiñca nidānañca sabhāvañca samuṭṭhānañca tikicchañca kiriyañca
translated: teachers, having known the origin of the disease, its cause, its nature, its source, its cure, its treatment,

original: siddhāsiddhañca sabbaṁ taṁ niravasesaṁ jānitvā ‘imasmiṁ kāye ettakā rogā uppajjissantī’ti
analyzed: siddha asiddham ca sabbam tam niravasesam jānitvā imasmin kāye ettakāḥ rogāḥ uppajjissanti iti
translated: its success and failure, all that without exception, and having determined that ‘in this body so many diseases will arise,’

original: ekappahārena kalāpaggāhaṁ karitvā suttaṁ bandhiṁsu, asabbaññuno ete sabbe, kissa🔽pana tathāgato sabbaññū samāno anāgataṁ kiriyaṁ buddhañāṇena jānitvā ‘ettake nāma
analyzed: eka ppahārena kalā apaggāham karitvā suttam bandhisu asabbaññunaḥ ete sabbe kissa  pana tathāgataḥ sabbaññū samānaḥ anāgatam kiriyam buddha ñāṇena jānitvā ettake nāma
translated: having taken a comprehensive view, wove it into a thread, and made a statement. They were not omniscient. Why then🔽should the Tathāgata, being omniscient, having known by his Buddha-knowledge the future action, and having determined that ‘in such and such a case such and such a training precept should be laid down,’

original: vatthusmiṁ ettakaṁ nāma sikkhāpadaṁ paññapetabbaṁ bhavissatī’ti paricchinditvā anavasesato
analyzed: vatthusmim ettakam nāma sikkhāpadam paññapetabbam bhavissati iti paricchinditvā anavasesato

original: sikkhāpadaṁ na paññapesi, uppannuppanne vatthusmiṁ ayase pākaṭe dose vitthārike puthugate
analyzed: sikkhāpadam na paññapesi uppanna uppanne vatthusmiṃ ayase pākaṭe dose vitthārike puthu gate
translated: and did not lay down training rules for disciples, but later, when the situation had become clear, when the faults had become widespread,

original: ujjhāyantesu manussesu tasmiṁ tasmiṁ kāle sāvakānaṁ sikkhāpadaṁ paññapesī”ti?
analyzed: ujjhāyantesu manussesu tasmin tasmin kāle sāvakānam sikkhāpadam paññapesi iti
translated: and people were complaining, did he then lay down training rules for disciples?”

original: “Ñātametaṁ, mahārāja, tathāgatassa ‘imasmiṁ samaye imesu manussesu sādhikaṁ diyaḍḍhasikkhāpadasataṁ🔽paññapetabbaṁ bhavissatī’ti, api ca tathāgatassa evaṁ ahosi ‘sace kho ahaṁ sādhikaṁ🔽diyaḍḍhasikkhāpadasataṁ ekappahāraṁ paññapessāmi, mahājano santāsamāpajjissati “bahukaṁ
analyzed: ñātam eta mahā rāja tathāgatassa imasmin samaye imesu manussesu sādhikam  paññapetabbam bhavissati iti api ca tathāgatassa evam ahosi sace kho aham sādhika  diyaḍḍha sikkhāpada satam eka ppahāram paññapessāmi mahājanaḥ santāsam āpajjissati bahuka
translated: “Great king, the Tathāgata knew that at that time, in those people, more than two hundred and fifty training rules🔽would have to be laid down. But he thought, ‘If I were to lay down more than two hundred and fifty training rules

original: idha rakkhitabbaṁ, dukkaraṁ vata bho samaṇassa gotamassa sāsane pabbajitun”ti, pabbajitukāmāpi
analyzed: idha rakkhitabba dukkaram vata bho samaṇassa gotamassa sāsane pabbajitunti pabbajitu kāmā api
translated: at one time, many people would become anxious, thinking, “There is much to be practiced and observed in this spiritual path. It’s hard to practice and observe.”🔽Those who want to go forth will not go forth,

original: na pabbajissanti, vacanañca me na saddahissanti, asaddahantā te manussā apāyagāmino
analyzed: na pabbajissanti vacanam ca me na saddahissanti a saddahantā te manussāḥ apāya gāmino
translated: and they will not believe my word. And those who do not believe will go to the nether world.

original: bhavissanti uppannuppanne vatthusmiṁ dhammadesanāya viññāpetvā pākaṭe dose sikkhāpadaṁ paññapessāmī’”ti.
analyzed: bhavissanti uppanna uppanne vatthusmim dhamma desanāya viññāpetvā pākaṭe dose sikkhāpadam paññapessāmi iti
translated: and when the matter has arisen and has been made clear by the explanation of the Dhamma, I will lay down a training rule.”

original: “Acchariyaṁ, bhante nāgasena, buddhānaṁ, abbhutaṁ, bhante nāgasena, buddhānaṁ, yāva
analyzed: acchariya bhante nāgasena buddhāna abbhuta bhante nāgasena buddhāna
translated: “It is wonderful, revered Nāgasena, it is marvellous, revered Nāgasena, how great is the omniscience of the Tathāgata,

original: mahantaṁ tathāgatassa sabbaññutañāṇaṁ, evametaṁ, bhante nāgasena, suniddiṭṭho eso
analyzed: mahantam tathāgatassa sabbaññuta ñāṇa evam eta bhante nāgasena su niddiṭṭhaḥ esaḥ
translated: so it is, revered Nāgasena, this matter has been well explained by the Tathāgata,

original: attho tathāgatena, ‘bahukaṁ idha sikkhitabban’ti sutvā sattānaṁ santāso uppajjeyya,
analyzed: attho tathāgatena bahukam idha sikkhitabban ti sutvā sattānam santāsaḥ uppajjeyya
translated: and hearing that ‘there is much to be trained in here’ beings would be terrified,

original: ekopi jinasāsane na pabbajeyya, evametaṁ tathā sampaṭicchāmī”ti.
analyzed: ekaḥ api jina sāsane na pabbajeyya evam etam tathā sampaṭicchāmi iti
translated: and no one would go forth in the Dispensation of the Conqueror. So it is, revered Nāgasena, I accept this explanation.”
